SurveyElements.SecondaryAttribute: Welcome to the survey on why you stopped believing the narrative taught by the church. The purpos...

Payload.QuestionText:
Welcome to the survey on why you stopped believing the narrative taught by the church.

The purpose of this survey is primarily to answer the question of why Mormons leave the church, or at least why they leave orthodox Mormonism.

We don't have an IRB for this so I won't be able to publish the results in an academic journal.  If you care about that sort of thing, you'll have to give us your blind faith that we will use this data for good and not evil.  IRB's are a pain in the butt, so we wouldn't want to really get into that anyway.  Once the results are published, if you want to use the results using a Category 4 exemption, knock yourself out.

The survey does not contain any questions that would allow me to identify you unless you write your name, give too many personal details, or something like that.  If you do this, it is your own fault.  We will make the final results available in an excel sheet, so don't write anything that would identify yourself.  Seriously.

We are also using built-in logic to disallow responses that come from the same computer.  Sorry if you live with your fellow non-believing significant other.  Use different devices if you both want to respond.

Please answer honestly.  No one here is judging you.  This is mostly for curiosity.

Finally, as we all know, a faith transition can be harrowing.  If talking about your experience is still too raw for you, you should probably skip the survey for now since most of the multiple choice questions are required.  When you are in a better place, we would love to hear your story.
Payload.QuestionDescription: Welcome to the survey on why you stopped believing the narrative taught by the church. The purpos...

Payload.QuestionDescription: Were you sealed in an LDS temple?

3.Display: Yes - sealed a later day, after our wedding day

SurveyElements.SecondaryAttribute: What are your feelings toward the LDS church?

Payload.QuestionText: What are your feelings toward the LDS church?
Payload.QuestionDescription: What are your feelings toward the LDS church?

1.Display: I think it is great and is a net positive in the world. I find truth in it, despite not finding its entire narrative to be true.

2.Display: I do not care about the church. It is so insignificant in the grand scheme of things that I don't think much about what it is doing or if it is good or bad.

3.Display: I think it is net negative in the world. I respect that others can find truth in it, but I think it does more harm than good.

4.Display: The church embodies evil. It is a truly terrible organization and should be opposed.

6.Display: My feelings shift between neutral and negative

7.Display: There are good parts and bad parts, and I can't say if the whole is good or bad

SurveyElements.SecondaryAttribute: Why have you told/not told friends or family? How would you react to leadership blackmail/extorti...

Payload.QuestionText:
Why have you told/not told friends or family? How would you react to leadership blackmail/extortion? (Attend or I call your parents, grandparents, relatives, boss, etc.)

Did church leaders try to sway your spouse or family? Did the church attempt to fellowship you back? Did you experience any hate from the church or members on your way out? What resources helped you cope with your transition? What where your positives as a member of the church? Could the church have done anything that could have helped you stay? Is your life better after leaving the church? Why? Do you feel the need to witness to others about the falseness of the church? Did your unbelief get labeled as "apostasy" by the church and where you excommunicated? Was your faith crisis the main reason for divorce by your spouse?

Questions about whether your spouse still believes and how this has impacted your transition.

Has the church experience damaged your faith in God and Christ

How long has it been since you last attended a Sunday church service?
